title: Civic poll surprise: Rare BJP‚ÄìCongress tie-up in Ambernath council; push to edge out Shiv Sena
content: In a surprising political maneuver, BJP and Congress have joined forces in Ambernath to oust the Shiv Sena from its stronghold. Despite Shiv Sena winning the most seats, the BJP-Congress alliance, bolstered by Ajit Pawar's NCP, has formed a majority. This unexpected coalition ahead of larger city elections has drawn sharp criticism from the Shiv Sena.

title: T20 WC: Bangladesh rejects ultimatum claims; BCB says ICC assures team's participation
content: Bangladesh Cricket Board has received a formal response from the ICC regarding security concerns for the T20 World Cup 2026 in India. The ICC reiterated its commitment to Bangladesh's participation and assured that their inputs on security planning will be considered. The BCB has denied any ultimatum was issued, calling such reports false and unfounded.

title: BJP worker 'stripped' by police during SIR drive in Hubbali; cops deny allegations
content: A BJP worker claims police assaulted her during a voter list revision in Hubballi. The incident followed a complaint by Congress corporator Suvarna Kallakuntla. Police state the worker resisted arrest and stripped herself. Counter-complaints have been filed by both sides. Senior police officials are reviewing the situation.

title: Google cofounder Larry Page leaves Silicon Valley: Moves assets to Delaware; here's why
content: Google cofounder Larry Page has shifted key business entities, including his family office, out of California to Delaware, Nevada, and Florida. This move precedes a potential state wealth tax, which could cost him billions. Other tech titans are also exploring exits, citing tax and privacy advantages offered by states like Delaware.

title: Indian presenter breaks silence on her Bangladesh Premier League exit
content: Indian presenter Ridhima Pathak clarified she voluntarily withdrew from the Bangladesh Premier League due to the political climate, refuting reports of being dropped. This comes amid heightened India-Bangladesh tensions, including a ban on IPL broadcasts in Bangladesh following a player dispute. The situation has led to significant BPL panel changes.

title: Gurgaon: Woman takes hours-long ride, threatens driver with false molestation case when asked to pay; booked
content: A woman in Gurgaon refused to pay her cab fare after an extensive ride, even threatening the driver with false police accusations. The driver filed a complaint, leading police to identify her as a repeat offender who had previously defrauded a salon and another cab driver. An FIR has been registered, and an arrest is imminent.

title: Apple execs won't leave South Korea: Hunting Samsung, SK Hynix supply; iPhone RAM at risk
content: Tech giants, including Apple, are reportedly camping out in South Korean hotels to secure crucial memory chip supplies.  A global shortage, driven by AI demand, has sent RAM prices soaring, forcing companies to negotiate long-term contracts.  This situation could lead to higher iPhone prices or reduced memory in future models.

title: 'Called out of factory, shot 7 times': Hindu man gunned down in Bangladesh
content: A Hindu leader and journalist in Bangladesh's Jessore district was shot dead by radical Islamists after regularly paying protection money. Rana Pratap Bairagi, affiliated with the Awami League, was targeted despite paying 3 lakh taka recently. His murder highlights the fear and extortion faced by minorities in the region.

title: Magic Johnson shares rare personal update with longtime rival Larry Bird
content: Magic Johnson shared a rare personal update after joining longtime rival Larry Bird at a public event in Phoenix. The two NBA legends spoke before a crowd of 4,000, revisiting the rivalry that shaped the league during the 1980s. Their appearance highlighted how the Magic-Bird competition continues to resonate decades after redefining basketball‚Äôs popularity and culture.

title: Google gets year 2026 ‚Äòwrong‚Äô: Musk responds with 3-word suggestion, says ‚ÄòNeed for improvement‚Äô:
content: Google's AI Overviews incorrectly stated that 2027 is not next year, prompting criticism from Elon Musk. This feature uses generative AI and the Gemini Pro 1.5 model to provide concise search summaries, aiming to assist with complex queries and planning tasks.

title: Kohli fans think his Rs 65,000 cardigan is sweet nod to wife Anushka as he arrives for NZ ODI
content: Virat Kohli made waves as he arrived in Mumbai for the New Zealand series, sporting a  cardigan embellished with a striking red 'A' and heart. Fans quickly speculated that this was a sweet nod to his wife, Anushka Sharma, igniting a flurry of affectionate posts across social media.

title: Delhi: MCD's demolition drive near mosque turns violent; 5 cops injured in stone pelting
content: Acting on Delhi High Court orders, the Municipal Corporation of Delhi conducted an early-morning demolition drive near Faiz-e-Elahi Masjid. Despite heavy police security and coordination efforts, a brief stone-pelting incident occurred, which was controlled with minimal force. The operation to clear encroached land proceeded with around 17 bulldozers.

title: Why NMC shut down the MBBS course at Vaishno Devi medical college in J&K
content: The National Medical Commission withdrew approval for the MBBS course at Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Institute of Medical Excellence after a surprise inspection found serious deficiencies in faculty, infrastructure and clinical exposure. Despite political protests over student composition, the shutdown was based on regulatory non-compliance. Existing students will be relocated to other medical colleges as supernumerary seats.

title: From $13mn to $8.4b: San Francisco 49ers owner York family net worth
content: Forbes ranks San Francisco 49ers owner Denise DeBartolo York and her family at $8.4 Billion, placing them ahead of Donald Trump and Mark Cuban. The York family controls over 90% of the 49ers, now valued above $8 Billion, after decades of growth tied to NFL success and global sports investments, according to Forbes 2025 rankings released in September this year.

title: MLB trade rumors: Blue Jays eye $500mn Chicago Cubs superstar signing
content: A potential trade between the Toronto Blue Jays and Houston Astros could see Kyle Tucker move to Toronto. This deal would significantly impact both teams, with Toronto acquiring a star outfielder and Houston focusing on cost control and future depth. The trade involves a steep prospect cost for Toronto and potential payroll flexibility for Houston.

title: Travis Kelce at breaking point as Taylor Swift reaches new career high
content: As the Chiefs wrapped up a disappointing season, Travis Kelce faced mounting questions about his NFL future and the possibility of retirement. At the same time, Taylor Swift reached another career high, extending her historic run atop the Billboard 200. The contrast highlighted a pivotal moment for the high-profile couple, with one career pausing as the other surged forward.

title: Mohanlal exits Chiranjeevi film: Rs 30 cr demand alters Bobby's plans - report
content: A major budget issue has reportedly stalled Chiranjeevi's film directed by Bobby, after Mohanlal's unexpected Rs 30 crore demand for a cameo. The makers, who hoped for a free appearance as a goodwill gesture, are now seeking a Telugu star for the role without payment.

title: Office productivity just performance? ‚ÄòI sit for 8 hrs & pretend to work,‚Äô shares employee
content: A Reddit post by a young intern highlights a growing workplace trend called ‚Äútask masking,‚Äù appearing busy without doing meaningful work. From interns to senior leaders, many admit to performing productivity rather than producing results. In reality, task masking is a management and culture problem, driven by visibility-based evaluation, unclear goals, and fear of being seen as idle.

title: 'You will rise...': Mahua Moitra pens poem for Umar Khalid; here's what she wrote
content: Trinamool MP Mahua Moitra shared a poem supporting jailed activist Umar Khalid after the Supreme Court denied him bail in a 2020 Delhi riots case. While Khalid and Sharjeel Imam were denied bail, others received it. JNU students reportedly raised anti-Modi slogans, drawing sharp criticism from BJP leaders who labelled them 'anti-India urban naxals' and condemned the slogans as 'treason'.

title: Deepika's strict upbringing sparks debate on modern parenting
content: Deepika Padukone shared her father's strict discipline methods.  This experience prompts a discussion on effective parenting.  Isolation tactics create fear, not understanding.  Constructive discipline focuses on teaching and positive reinforcement.  Setting clear rules and allowing choices builds confidence.  Disrupting generational patterns requires self-reflection.  Padukone's openness encourages evolving family legacies.

title: Gold price prediction today: Where are gold, silver prices headed?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold and silver prices may see volatility with some consolidative bias in the coming days, says Maneesh Sharma, AVP - Commodities & Currencies, Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers. He shares his outlook for gold and silver prices in the coming days:

title: Egg-cellent tips: Chefs' secret to perfect boiled eggs
content: Boiling an egg is not easy, but it is one of the most daunting tasks if you don't know the basics and trust us, the basics are quite hard to master. From your choice of the yolk to the time to the temperature of the water to the age of the egg, everything together contributes to the final texture of a boiled egg.

title: After 10 daughters, Haryana couple welcome a son; father denies patriarchy claims
content: A Haryana woman has given birth to her eleventh child, a son, after ten daughters. The high-risk delivery was successful, with both mother and child recovering well. The father expressed happiness and denied patriarchal attitudes, emphasizing his daughters' capabilities despite societal preferences for male children.

title: Who is Nikki Bella‚Äôs boyfriend Cooper DeJean? Age-gap romance confirmed
content: Nikki Bella and Philadelphia Eagles cornerback Cooper DeJean have been spending time together, fueling dating speculation after public appearances and game-day sightings. Sources say the relationship is casual, with Bella focused on her career and raising her son. DeJean, a rising NFL star and Super Bowl champion, remains focused on football as interest in their 20-year age gap connection grows.

title: Nasa saw inside a white dwarf system for the 1st time; the view surprised scientists
content: NASA's IXPE telescope has revealed new details about the white dwarf star EX Hydrae, observing it not just as a point of light but as a structured system. For the first time, scientists measured the height of hot gas above the star, offering a deeper understanding of these extreme cosmic environments and paving the way for new astronomical observations.

title: Rohit Sharma offered vada pav by a fan; Hitman's reaction goes viral - watch
content: Rohit Sharma politely declined a fan's vada pav offer while intensely preparing for India's ODI series against New Zealand. The star batter, who has had a landmark year with numerous achievements and records, is dedicating significant time to training.

title: Indore: Cong demands Rs 1cr aid for families of deceased; calls Rs 2L relief an ‚Äòinsult to victims‚Äô
content: Congress leaders Jitu Patwari and Umang Singhar visited Indore's Bhagirathpura following a deadly contaminated water crisis. They criticized the state government's response, demanding higher compensation and accountability from officials. The visit was met with heavy police presence, highlighting escalating political tensions over the incident.

title: Bihar: RLM on brink of split as 3 MLAs revolt over ‚Äòparivar politics‚Äô
content: Amidst a brewing political storm, Panchayati Raj Minister Deepak Prakash finds himself in a tight spot as three out of four MLAs from Rashtriya Lok Morcha are reportedly considering a switch to the NDA. Frustration is palpable among the MLAs, who are disturbed by Upendra Kushwaha's choice to appoint his own son, Deepak, as minister without having a legislative seat.

title: 134-year-old record shattered: Australia create history in Ashes; achieve rare Test feat
content: Australia achieved a remarkable batting feat at the SCG, registering seven partnerships of 50 or more runs in an Ashes innings, a feat unseen in 134 years. Steve Smith's unbeaten century and Travis Head's 163 propelled Australia to a commanding first-innings lead against England, showcasing exceptional batting consistency.

title: Odisha: Jaundice cases rise to 52 at Khurda JNV; school likely to remain open for classes X & XII
content: Jaundice cases at Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya in Khurda district have surged to 52, prompting the school to consider closing for all but classes X and XII.  Medical teams are conducting tests, and water samples have been collected for contamination analysis.  Efforts are underway to break the disease chain and ensure student safety.

title: 'Controlled by me‚Äô: Trump says Venezuela to send US up to 50 million barrels of oil; lays out plan
content: President Trump announced Venezuela's interim authorities will transfer 30-50 million barrels of sanctioned oil to the US. The crude will be sold at market prices, with proceeds controlled by the US government to benefit both nations. This move aims to leverage Venezuela's oil reserves, which have accumulated due to US sanctions.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office: Ranveer, Akshaye starrer surpasses Rs 1,220 crore worldwide
content: 'Dhurandhar' shows resilience at the box office, recovering from a recent dip. The film earned approximately Rs 4.75 crore on its thirty-third day, maintaining a steady graph after a significant drop. Despite slipping into single digits in its fifth week, the movie has amassed a substantial Rs 781.75 crore net in India, with worldwide collections exceeding Rs 1,220 crore.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens below 26,150; BSE Sensex down over 100 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Wednesday. While Nifty50 went below 26,150, BSE Sensex was down over 100 points.

title: Busted! Luxury handbag thieves caught mid-heist in California; heavily armed cops swoop in ‚Äî watch
content: Two individuals were arrested by Irvine Police after a CCTV-captured burglary attempt at a luxury handbag store. The suspects, Richard Bernard Spencer and Marcellus Ronell Shelby, were found with nearly $100,000 worth of stolen goods. They face multiple charges including burglary and grand theft.

title: Jordyn Woods flashes wedding ring in glowing winter look
content: Jordyn Woods shared a winter snapshot that subtly highlighted her engagement ring following her Christmas Day proposal from NBA star Karl-Anthony Towns. Wearing a cozy monochromatic look and sleek braids, Woods kept the focus on understated style and personal meaning. The post follows earlier public appearances where the emerald cut ring drew attention during Knicks games and social media updates.

title: Daisy Shah slams election campaigners after fire breaks out near her flat; shares video
content: A fire erupted in Bandra East, Mumbai, during an election campaign, sparking outrage from actor Daisy Shah. She criticized campaigners for their recklessness, specifically the use of fireworks near residential buildings, highlighting a lack of civic sense and demanding accountability for the incident.

title: Maharashtra: Female student forced to perform namaz at medical college; 2 staffers suspended
content: A female medical student in Palghar was allegedly forced to perform namaz by another student, leading to police action and the suspension of a hostel warden and teacher. The incident, believed to be ragging, triggered campus tension and protests, prompting a police investigation and heavy deployment.

title: UP SIR: Nearly 3 crore names deleted from draft rolls; claims open till Feb 6, final list on Mar 6
content: Uttar Pradesh's draft voter rolls reveal nearly 3 crore deletions, with 18.7% of electors removed. Over 1.3 crore voters were identified as having permanently shifted, while others were untraceable or deceased. Citizens have until February 6 to file claims and objections to reinstate their names before final rolls are published on March 6.

title: Chilly winds, poor air hit Delhiites; dense fog at Palam reduces visibility to 100 metres
content: Delhi experienced cold day conditions Tuesday due to chilly winds and dense fog, with a yellow alert issued for Wednesday. Maximum temperatures dropped significantly in some areas, though not universally meeting the 'cold day' criteria. Air quality also worsened, remaining in the 'very poor' category for the upcoming week.

title: Harbaugh out as Ravens coach after playoff miss
content: The Ravens fired John Harbaugh, less than 48 hours after losing to the Steelers and failing to reach the playoffs. Sources told ESPN that he's expected to emerge as a favorite for the Giants job but will be in demand for many other teams as well.

title: QB Williams hits portal despite signed UW deal
content: Washington quarterback Demond Williams Jr. said on social media Tuesday night he is entering the transfer portal, a move that comes just days after he agreed to return to the Huskies for the 2026 season.

title: Chambliss pleads case, hopeful NCAA OKs waiver
content: Trinidad Chambliss acknowledged being a "little frustrated" as he awaits an NCAA decision on a potential waiver for the 2026 season, while his lawyer, Tom Mars, told ESPN that they're working on immediate contingency plans in the event it's denied.

title: Longhorns great Shipley severely burned on ranch
content: Former Texas Longhorns star Jordan Shipley is in critical but stable condition after suffering "severe" burns in an accident on his ranch in Texas on Tuesday, his family said.

title: Top prospect Peterson forces OT in wild KU rally
content: Kansas freshman Darryn Peterson scored a career-high 32 points, including three free throws to tie the score at the end of regulation, in a 104-100 comeback win over TCU.

title: LeBron says it's on him to bend game around Luka
content: Amid his recent scoring surge, Lakers star LeBron James reiterated Tuesday night that teammate Luka Doncic doesn't "need to bend his game [for me]," adding, "It's up to us to bend our game around him."

title: Declining Devils author 'embarrassing' 9-0 loss
content: The New Jersey Devils, struggling for nearly two months after a scorching 8-1 start, are now searching for answers after a 9-0 loss to the New York Islanders Tuesday, one in which goaltender Jacob Markstrom gave up goals on the first two shots he faced.

title: LSU's Weis with Rebels; has done 'terrific job'
content: Ole Miss offensive assistant Joe Judge praised offensive coordinator Charlie Weis Jr. for how he has been able to juggle his responsibilities with the Rebels and LSU.

content: The Packers need a WR1? The Broncos can't keep winning tight games? The Pats' run defense and the Seahawks' run offense are problems? We're not so sure.

title: Army outreach in border areas: Solar plant set up in Sikkim; water facility built in Arunachal
content: a 10-KW solar power plant in north Sikkim and a water storage facility in Arunachal Pradesh has been built . the plant has improved night-time safety, enhancing connectivity and eliminating the need for seasonal migration during the harsh winter months .

title: Bengaluru Police Bust Laptop Theft Racket Targeting Techies, 2 Arrested
content: Bengaluru Police have busted a laptop theft racket in the Electronic City area, arresting two people who allegedly stole dozens of laptops from Paying Guest (PG) accommodations across the city.

title: Stray Dogs Supreme Court Hearing Live: "Can't Read A Dog's Mind When He Is In A Mood To Bite": Supreme Court
content: Amid the rising dog bite incidents, the Supreme Court, on November 7, last year, ordered the removal of stray dogs from educational institutions, hospitals, bus stands, sports complexes, and railway stations.

title: "Donald, I Beg You": Trump Mocks French's Emmanuel Macron Over Tariffs
content: US President Donald Trump mocked his French counterpart, Emmanuel Macron, in a rare impression, recounting how he coerced Paris into agreeing to triple its drug prices by threatening to hike tariffs on all French imports to America.

title: Kannada Actor Dhanush Raj Alleges Physical Assault, Harassment By Wife
content: Kannada actor Dhanush Raj, known for his work in films and television serials, has filed a police complaint against his wife Arshita, accusing her of physical assault, harassment, and issuing life threats.

title: In Rural Madhya Pradesh, Every Third Glass Of Drinking Water Is Unsafe: Report
content: A new report by the central government's Jal Jeevan Mission revealed that only 63.3% of water samples in Madhya Pradesh passed quality tests, compared to a national average of 76%.

title: What Led To Clash During Demolition Drive Near Delhi Mosque: A Timeline
content: A violent clash erupted early this morning during an anti-encroachment drive near a mosque in Delhi. Locals threw stones at municipal officials and police teams during the demolition on a land adjoining the Syed Faiz Elahi mosque at Ramlila Maidan.

title: Karnataka BJP Worker's 'Clothes Torn' Charge. Cops Claim 'She Stripped'
content: The Hubballi police commissioner said the woman worker took her clothes off and attacked the police personnel.

title: "Trump Wants To Takeover Greenland, Redraw Map": Ian Bremmer To NDTV
content: US President Donald Trump wants to take over Greenland from Denmark and "redraw the map", Ian Bremmer, Founder and President of the Eurasia Group, told NDTV's Editor-in-Chief Rahul Kanwal.

title: "They Offer Free Advice": S Jaishankar On Western "Hypocrisy" Over Op Sindoor
content: S Jaishankar said some distant countries express concern over tensions elsewhere but ignore the risks within their own regions.

title: Amravati Project Phase-2 Begins, Farmers Want Guarantees Before Giving Land
content: Andhra Pradesh's ambitious capital city project has entered a decisivephase, with the state government formally launching the second round of land pooling for Amaravati.

title: "Kick Out China, Russia, Iran": Team Trump's New Oil Warning To Venezuela
content: US President Donald Trump reportedly wants Venezuela's new regime under interim president Delcy Rodriguez to "kick out" and "sever" economic ties with China, Russia, Iran and Cuba before being allowed to pump more oil.

title: Behind Pakistan's Teen Spy Network, A Design To Brainwash Minors
content: A spy network of teenagers has emerged as a major security challenge in India after white-collar terrorism, with Pakistan's intelligence agency now found to be trapping and brainwashing minors to work for them.

title: "You Will Rise": Mahua Moitra Pens Poem For Umar Khalid After Bail Denial
content: Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra on Wednesday penned a short poem in support of jailed activist Umar Khalid after the Supreme Court denied bail to the latter in an alleged larger conspiracy behind the 2020 north-east Delhi riots.

title: After Census And Poll Duties, Teachers In Bihar Now Told To Count Dogs
content: In Bihar, where teachers are already juggling from census duties and Booth Level Officer (BLO) work to caste surveys, often at the cost of classroom teaching, there seems to be yet another task waiting to be added to their list.

title: Explained: What Is "Perfect February" And Why It Is Taking Over X
content: In 2026, the month of February begins on a Sunday and ends on a Saturday, fitting perfectly into the calendar layout.

title: Nicolas Maduro's Immunity Claim Can Pose Challenge For US Prosecutors: Report
content: Nicols Maduro's first appearance in a US courtroom offered a glimpse of the legal battle ahead over rarely tested questions  chief among them whether he can claim immunity from prosecution.

title: After Maduro's Capture, Venezuela's Security Chief Now On US' Target List
content: The US has put Venezuela's hardline interior minister on notice that he could be at the top of its target list unless he helps Interim President Delcy Rodriguez meet US demands and keep order following the toppling of Nicolas Maduro.

title: Kerala Lover, Friend Stage Road Accident To Win Over Woman, Arrested
content: What looked like a road accident on a busy evening in this district has now been exposed as a carefully planned crime, driven by obsession and deceit.

title: 100% Women Reservation In Nursing Colleges Challenged In Madhya Pradesh Court
content: The petition argues that the recruitment process violates Articles 14, 15 and 16 of the Constitution, which guarantee equality before the law and prohibit discrimination on grounds of sex.

title: Trump Withholds Child Care Funding Over Fraud Concerns In 5 States
content: President Donald Trumps administration said Tuesday that it is withholding funding for programmes that support needy families with children in five Democratic-led states over concerns about fraud.

title: Divisional rankings: Nakatani makes debut at 122 pounds
content: the end of 2025 saw some movement as a former heavyweight champion made his way back into the rankings . a future opponent wasn't quite as impressive in his divisional debut . "The Gypsy King" announced his return to the ring .

title: Early wild card bets: How to bet Packers-Bears, Bills-Jaguars
content: the playoffs kick off with the Los Angeles Rams at the Carolina Panthers, followed by the Green Bay Packers at Chicago Bears . on Sunday, the red-hot Houston Texans hit the road to face the Pittsburgh Steelers .

title: Nathan MacKinnon vs. Macklin Celebrini for MVP?
content: Connor McDavid won the past two Selke Trophies as the NHL's best defensive forward . he has yet to play a game this season after a preseason injury required knee surgery . the 19-year-old has announced his arrival among the league's superstars and in the MVP race .

title: 2026 Unrivaled megapreview: Rosters, rankings, rules, how to watch
content: 54 of the league's top players are in Miami as the second season of unrivaled tips off . the 3-on-3 league was created to give players a domestic offseason playing opportunity . each member of this season's championship team will win an additional $100,000 .

title: Why Man United sacked Ruben Amorim: Basic tactics, player issues, transfer frustration
content: manchester united sacking Ruben Amorim after 14 months at the club . the club's style of play "will be determined in this room," says sir Jim Ratcliffe . he was told that hiring amorim was a risk; he warned that reshaping the squad would take millions .

title: What does Pete Carroll's exit mean for the Raiders, Geno Smith?
content: Pete Carroll led the Raiders to a 3-14 record -- his worst as a coach . the 74-year-old was fired on monday with 17 games into his three-year deal . he was "blindly optimistic" about the talent on the roster .

title: NFL futures: Seahawks enter playoffs as Super Bowl favorites, Rams right behind
content: The top two teams in the NFC West have the best odds to win the Super Bowl heading into the playoffs. The  Seattle Seahawks  are the favorites to win Super Bowl 60, following closely by the division rival  Los Angeles Rams . The AFC West-winning  Denver Broncos  have the third-best odds to win the Super Bowl as the top overall seed in the AFC. They, like the Seahawks, will have a bye in the first round. Here are the Super Bowl odds and conference championship odds for every team still in the hunt. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.

title: Europe sees red over Greenland as Trump aide asserts it belongs to US

With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: What to know about every team

title: Tracking live who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: From No. 1 to nowhere: Ranking the biggest disasters of the 2025 season
